questions.question: When people protest unjust laws by peacefully refusing to obey them, they are

choices.answer: taking part in an unconstitutional act.
breaking the law and will be arrested.

questions.question: Tariffs protected the interests of what group?
The Underground Railroad existed to

choices.answer: help escaped slaves travel north to freedom.
circulate abolitionist literature in the South.
help southern plantation owners capture runaway slaves.

questions.question: Some Americans supported slavery because they believed that

choices.answer: abolitionists did not tell the truth.
their continued prosperity relied on slavery.
slave rebellions proved that slaves could not be trusted.
African Americans were the best farm laborers.

questions.question: Early successes in the women's rights movement related primarily to
What was one result of the Dred Scott decision?

choices.answer: The federal government's power to eliminate slavery grew.
Enslaved African Americans lost their standing as citizens.
Slavery was ended in Illinois and Missouri.
Southerners could no longer claim slaves as property.

questions.question: The Wilmot Proviso proposed

choices.answer: a ban on slavery in newly acquired Mexican territory.
the immediate end of slavery in the South.
expansion of slavery to the North.
the admission of new states as slave states.

questions.question: The Fugitive Slave Act

choices.answer: required citizens to catch or turn in runaway slaves.
was particularly unpopular in the South.
was very popular in both the North and South.

questions.question: John Brown's raid on Harpers Ferry was intended to

choices.answer: steal enough weapons to invade the South.
inspire local slaves to join a revolt.

questions.question: What effect did the fall of Fort Sumter have?

choices.answer: South Carolina seceded from the Union.
Union troops showed their military superiority.
The Union's surrender led to the Civil War.
The South withdrew from Union military posts.

questions.question: The goal of the Anaconda Plan was to

choices.answer: recruit former slaves into the Union army.
cut off the South's food and supplies.

questions.question: How did many women support the war effort?

African Americans joined the Union army in greater numbers after the
What was one problem that damaged the cause of Radical Republicans?

choices.answer: growth of the Ku Klux Klan

questions.question: What was the immediate effect of the Fourteenth Amendment?

choices.answer: Former enslaved African Americans became citizens.
Segregation was instituted in the South.

questions.question: Congress tried to regain control of Reconstruction by
What was one immediate goal of Reconstruction?

choices.answer: to rejoin the North and South
to bring African Americans and whites together

questions.question: Why was General Grant involved in Andrew Johnson's impeachment?

choices.answer: Grant was a prominent Republican working to impeach Johnson.
Johnson had committed a military crime.
